intro: Nolletia chrysocomoides, commonly known as the golden-leaf nolletia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow-green leaves and showy, pale yellow flowers that bloom during the wet season. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodland or grassland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
